data.title: UI render Bug
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.3
- OS Version: mac OS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a folder or some files in editor.
2. move window to external display, and toggle to full screen.
3. Unplug your Display port video line and switch to another external display with different resolutionï¼Œe.g. 2K to 1080p.And editor show some strange shadow blocks.
   ![2016-10-04 15 15 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9696289/19065432/14e9f076-8a46-11e6-8ea1-86a8b4b93c7e.png)
   ![2016-10-04 15 16 08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9696289/19065441/22003e3c-8a46-11e6-96ba-110cbcfe7692.png)
   ![2016-10-04 15 23 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9696289/19065500/7d284318-8a46-11e6-83e0-1861d554630a.png)

As you see, once the UI bug shows up , it will not dismiss when I change my color theme or window size.I often use different resolution display in my office and home. So this bug is quite a confusion to me

data.title: Does travis not load the workspace anymore?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Travis CI v??? :-)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Code a test that uses stuff from the workspace.
2. Run tests on headless travis ci

It seems that the workspace is not correctly loaded since some releases (1.5 I presume).
When I use some workspace files in my tests, they aren't correctly loaded and my tests fail.

The travis yaml seems complete (I hope at least):

``` yaml
sudo: false

language: node_js
node_js:
- '6'

os:
- osx

install:
- npm run bootstrap
- npm run build

script:
- npm test --silent

env:
  global:
    - CODE_TESTS_WORKSPACE=$TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/.test/
```

Did I forget something?

When I run the following command on my OSX, it works like a charm: `CODE_TESTS_WORKSPACE=$PWD/.test/ npm test`

Cheers

data.title: best way to use VSCode to view and edit a graphical file
data.body:
Request for information on what classes to extend to implement this behavior myself in VSCode. Looking for guidance. 
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 7 sp1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a file myfile.esfc that is a proprietary format
2. display a graphical representation of that file in html using a custom parser and graphics package
3. allow the user to edit that graphical representation with custom controls/commands
4. allow the user to save those changes back to the proprietary format

I've looked at the previewHtml extension and created a TextDocumentContentProvider, but what I am trying to do is use VSCode as a framework for editing and verifying chart diagrams not just preview them. 

It looks like the editor.contribution.ts contains the functions that register the different types of IEditorDesctiptor; string, text diff, binary with their associated IEditorInput.  Is this where a custom chartEditor and chartInput could be registered? where is the transition from file contents to the view being done? Is this done in EditorPart? It looks like it is asking the registered editor for the input to show the contents.  It looks like the fileEditorInput is used to get the appropriate IEditorDescriptor from the registry.

data.title: [snippets] Global snippet option

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Currently snippets are defined by language type and only available when a file of that language is open.  In an effort to not reproduce snippets between languages I'd like to see a "global" snippet .json file that makes snippets available for any file type, in addition to the file type specific ones defined in Code...Preferences...User Snippets.

Example.  I've created a snippet for the CSS margin option: 

`"margin": {
    "prefix": "Z_margin",
    "body": ["margin: ${1:top}px ${2:right}px ${3:bottom}px ${4:left}px;${5:}"],
    "description": "Margin"
}`

I'd like to have that available for .css, .html, and .php files without haveing to copy it in all three .json files.

data.title: Files in folder not reloading after switching git branch

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: MacOS 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a branch "test" in a big project
2. add some files in a folder
3. switch to master branch
4. those new files will disappear from the Explorer (normal)
5. switch back to the "test" branch
6. those new files don't re-appear in the Explorer => not normal
7. restart Visual Code and those files appear 

This bug is present since some versions (around 1 month).

Please let me know if you need more details

data.title: Could be unclear that in-product Extensions Details rating number is ratings count.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

We display the ratings stars in two places in the Extensions View:
1. The list entry with a single star and rating number (3, 4.5, etc).
2. The details banner with a filled-in 5 star display and ratings count.

In the two locations, the numbers mean two different things (average rating versus ratings count) and this could be confusing (especially if the number of ratings was between 1 and 5).
It would be clearer if the details banner ratings count had the word "ratings" after the number (for example "19 ratings").

data.title: Consider adding a tooltip to the in-product Extension details install count
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Consider adding a tooltip for the install count. Some users might not understand that the cloud image and number refer to the install count.

data.title: Consider adding a tooltip to the in-product Extension details extension identifier
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

To help with creating recommended workspace extensions and extension pack list, we display the extension identifier on the Extension View extension details top banner (for example "dbankier.vscode-instant-markdown").
Consider adding a tooltip to explain the possibly cryptic string (for example "Kasik96.format-indent" for PHP Code Format from Martin Kase).
Something like "extension identifier (publisher.extension)"

data.title: HTML img tag is reformatted despite setting "html.format.unformatted"
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601 Steps to Reproduce: 1. VS Code's setting "html.format.unformatted": includes img, so it should NOT be reformatted 2. I have an img tag in Django HTML template. 3. If I press CTRL-S to save the file, VS Code adds extra space characters around the .png file name. Because of this the image file is not found when I browse the site This step3 is the bug. If I save from menu File/Save, then this img tag is NOT reformatted. So it works differently depending on whether you save from CTRL-S or from File menu.

data.title: Install from VSIX... has no Command Palette command, no entry in Default Keyboard Shortcuts
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

All other Extensions View dropdown commands are available in the Command Palette as "Extensions: ".
There is also no entry calling out the action in Default Keyboard Shortcuts.
Seem reasonable that a user would want to launch "Install from VSIX..." from the Command Palette or add a keyboard shortcut.

data.title: [coffeescript] Syntax Support for 1.11.1 `import` and `export
data.body:
CoffeeScript 1.11 adds support for [ES2015 modules](http://coffeescript.org/#modules). It would be nice to update the syntax highlighting to reflect this.

---
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Switch language to CoffeeScript.
2. Type `import _ from 'lodash';`

**Expected Result:**

Code is properly highlighted.

**Actual Result:**

Tokens are not recognized.

data.title: Intellisense not picking up file move
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.5.3
Commit 5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27
Date 2016-09-22T08:40:08.699Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
- OS Version:
  Ubuntu Linux 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. C# Project with dotnet core plugin
2. Create Files in folders and compile project
   Root > src > ApplicationDir > folder > foo.cs
3. Add new folder beside file
   Root > src > ApplicationDir > folder  
   > foo.cs
   > folder2
4. Move file into folder
   Root > src > ApplicationDir > folder > folder2 > foo.cs

Intellisense thinks it's a duplicate file and hilights with errors saying class/methods already exist, even though it runs and debugs.

Close code an reopen it and problem goes away.

data.title: Corporate Proxy Errors (Self Signed Certificate in Chain) (Everything used to work before)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio Code

An error pops up saying 

> "Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain"

When I open developer tools, the following info is displayed:

```
keybindingResolver.ts:189 Conflict detected, command `cursorUpSelect` cannot be triggered by ctrl+shift+up due to fsharp.MoveFileUp
keybindingResolver.ts:189 Conflict detected, command `cursorDownSelect` cannot be triggered by ctrl+shift+down due to fsharp.MoveFileDown
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] vscode-icons is active!
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] Spell and Grammar checker active...
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] Default Settings
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] Code Actons Registering for: markdown
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] Code Actons Registering for: plaintext
messageService.ts:119 self signed certificate in certificate chain: Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain
    at Error (native)
    at TLSSocket.<anonymous> (_tls_wrap.js:1065:38)
    at emitNone (events.js:80:13)
    at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:179:7)
    at TLSSocket._finishInit (_tls_wrap.js:593:8)
    at TLSWrap.ssl.onhandshakedone (_tls_wrap.js:425:38)e.doShow @ messageService.ts:119e.show @ messageService.ts:103e.onError @ extensionsWorkbenchService.ts:474(anonymous function) @ extensionsWorkbenchService.ts:299n.Class.define.done @ winjs.base.raw.js:1378m @ winjs.base.raw.js:1224B.enter @ winjs.base.raw.js:901n.Class.define._run @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068n.Class.define._chainedError @ winjs.base.raw.js:1031n @ winjs.base.raw.js:736m @ winjs.base.raw.js:1209B.enter @ winjs.base.raw.js:901n.Class.define._run @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068n.Class.define._error @ winjs.base.raw.js:1041(anonymous function) @ async.ts:135n.Class.define.done @ winjs.base.raw.js:1378m @ winjs.base.raw.js:1224B.enter @ winjs.base.raw.js:901n.Class.define._run @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068n.Class.define._chainedError @ winjs.base.raw.js:1031n @ winjs.base.raw.js:736n.Class.define.then @ winjs.base.raw.js:1436R.enter @ winjs.base.raw.js:747n.Class.define._run @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068n.Class.define._setCompleteValue @ winjs.base.raw.js:1052m @ winjs.base.raw.js:1209B.enter @ winjs.base.raw.js:901n.Class.define._run @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068n.Class.define._chainedError @ winjs.base.raw.js:1031n @ winjs.base.raw.js:736m @ winjs.base.raw.js:1209B.enter @ winjs.base.raw.js:901n.Class.define._run @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068n.Class.define._error @ winjs.base.raw.js:1041emitOne @ events.js:90emit @ events.js:182socketErrorListener @ _http_client.js:295emitOne @ events.js:90emit @ events.js:182emitErrorNT @ net.js:1253_combinedTickCallback @ internal/process/next_tick.js:74_tickCallback @ internal/process/next_tick.js:98
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] [IONIDE-FSAC-SIG] started message? true
threadService.ts:217 [Extension Host] [I] 2016-10-03T20:52:09.4901172Z: listener started in 22.000 ms with binding 127.0.0.1:8184 [Suave.Tcp.tcpIpServer]
```

I have the following settings in my user settings:

```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    // Controls auto save of dirty files. Accepted values:  "off", "afterDelay", "onFocusChange". If set to "afterDelay" you can configure the delay in "files.autoSaveDelay".
    "files.autoSave": "onFocusChange",

    //-------- HTTP configuration --------

    // // The proxy setting to use. If not set will be taken from the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables
    "http.proxy": "http://usproxy.es.***.com:8080",
    "https.proxy": "http://usproxy.es.***.com:8080",

    // // Whether the proxy server certificate should be verified against the list of supplied CAs.
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false,

    "eslint.enable": true,
    "eslint.options": {
                    "rules": {
                        "eqeqeq": [2, "allow-null"]
                    }
                },

    "editor.wrappingColumn": 0
}
```

I am able to make bower work on my same computer with the same corporate firewall using these settings in .bowerrc

```
{
  "directory": "bower_components",
  "proxy":"http://usproxy.es.***.com:8080",
  "https-proxy":"http://usproxy.es.***.com:8080",
  "strict-ssl": false
}
```

I am also able to make npm work on my same computer with the same corporate firewall using these settings in .npmrc

```
proxy=http://usproxy.es.***.com:8080/
https-proxy=http://usproxy.es.***.com:8080/
strict-ssl=false
```

Also, when I try to go to the extension gallery I get the following error:

> "Error: Marketplace returned 'ECONNREFUSED'. Please check the 'http.proxy' setting.

The developer tools shows the following information:

```
6messageService.ts:119 Marketplace returned 'ECONNREFUSED'. Please check the 'http.proxy' setting.: Error: Marketplace returned 'ECONNREFUSED'. Please check the 'http.proxy' setting.
    at Object._ [as create] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:34:29245)
    at t.onError (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViewlet.js:4:16408)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViewlet.js:4:13184
    at n.Class.define.done (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:18833)
    at Object.m [as _notify] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:13621)
    at Object.B.enter (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:16953)
    at n.Class.define._run (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:18274)
    at n.Class.define._chainedError (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:17633)
    at n (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:15456)
    at Object.m [as _notify] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:13448)
```

I know for a fact that this used to work and I was able to successfully install extensions from behind my corporate firewall/proxy.  However, after some update to VS Code (not sure which one) this stopped working.  

Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks!

data.title: enter key does not make new lines
data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:

Unclear step to reproduce.
Sometimes problem intermittent, spamming enter 10 times will sometimes unlock it and let it create new lines again. Many tabs open, complex folder open in the folder viewer.

Debugging steps taken:
- Tried different physical keyboard  
- Tried onscreen keyboard
- Tried uninstalling all extensions
- Tried restart that comes with uninstalling an extension
- Tried switching tabs and typing (can type)

data.title: Enable terminal themes via tmTheme
Question: Minimum width for VS Code status bar icon

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.
